Salome se je vrnila na Hrvaško
Zvezdnica se je v domovino vrnila po enajstih letih. Razlog za selitev k našim sosedom tiči v novem projektu.
03 Nov 2019, 20:27 by A. K.



Salome v hrvaški različici Menopavze FOTO: MARE MILIN



Sanja Doležal, Salome, Karmela Vukov Colić in Arijana Čulina FOTO: MARE MILIN



Salome na odru s Heleno Blagne, Zvezdano Mlakar in Urško Vučak Markež FOTO: JURE MAKOVEC


Jezična Salome, ki smo jo lahko spremljali v različnih resničnostnih šovih, se vrača v domovino. Razlog za selitev na Hrvaško tiči v njenem novem projektu, predstavi oziroma muzikalu Menopavza, v katerem bo zaigrala skupaj s Sanjo Doležal, Arijano Čulina in Karmelo Vukov Colić. Tja se seli po enajstih letih oz. prvič, odkar si je dala spremeniti spol. Da je srečna kot še nikoli, Salome ne skriva; nedavno si je dala postriči dolge lase, shujšala je, zdaj pa živi v kar dveh državah in ima polne roke dela s predstavami pri nas in na Hrvaškem. »Če mora kdo govoriti o hormonskih spremembah, sem to jaz. Ženske se ne zavedajo, da so ob rojstvu v dar dobile ženstvenost, jaz pa sem jo morala ustvariti. Dolga leta sem se trudila, da sem ustvarila žensko, kakršna bi se morala roditi.


Sanja Doležal, Salome, Karmela Vukov Colić in Arijana Čulina FOTO: MARE MILIN

V predstavi predstavljam del svojega boja, da sem končno postala to, kar sem, ženskam pa ob tem polagam na srce, naj bodo hvaležne, ker so ženske,« pravi Salome, ki se je rodila na Rabu kot Nenad v obdobju, ko se o transseksualnosti ni govorilo. »Takrat sem bila vse, le človek ne. Ljudje so mislili, da sem sama naredila takšno osebo iz sebe, niso se zavedali, da se ljudje takšni rodijo,« doda Salome, ki se je zaradi okolice in ljudi, ki je niso mogli in znali sprejeti, preselila v Slovenijo, v deželo, ki je sprejela njeno drugačnost.»Tudi ženske, ki redno zahajajo v cerkev, so me lepo sprejele, in to mi veliko pomeni,« je zadovoljna Salome, ki vsako leto obišče rodni Rab, kjer živijo njeni starši. Oče in mati sta dejstvo, da je njun sin postal hči, sicer težko sprejela. »Ko so ljudje mlajši, se obremenjujejo s tem, kaj bodo rekli sosedje, potem pa pridejo v leta, ko dojamejo, da je pomemben njihov otrok. Nisem morilka, nisem tatica, nisem narkomanka, nisem prostitutka, zakaj bi me kdo hotel obsojati? Živim svoje življenje in srečna sem, ker sem končno postala tisto, kar sem si vedno želela,« pravi in doda, da si nikoli ni predstavljala, da bo imela nekoč dve stanovanji – eno v Zagrebu, drugo v Ljubljani. »Veliko bom na poti, a se zelo veselim. Neskončno sem hvaležna in srečna, da so se mi odprla ta vrata,« o novem projektu na Hrvaškem pravi Salome, ki je postala v slovenski različici Menopavze, v kateri nastopa ob Heleni Blagne, Urški Vučak Markež in Zvezdani Mlakar oziroma Damjani Golavšek, prava zvezdnica.


Salome na odru s Heleno Blagne, Zvezdano Mlakar in Urško Vučak Markež FOTO: JURE MAKOVEC

Tudi ženske, ki redno zahajajo v cerkev, so me lepo sprejele, in to mi veliko pomeni.

Salome returned to Croatia
The star returned home after eleven years. The reason for moving to our neighbors lies in a new project.
03 Nov 2019, 19:27 by A.K.



Salome in the Croatian version of Menopause PHOTO: MARE MILIN



Sanja Dolezal, Salome, Karmela Vukov Colic and Arijana Culin PHOTO: MARE MILIN



Salome on stage with Helena Blagne, Zvezda Mlakar and Urško Vučak Markež PHOTO: JURE MAKOVEC


The Salome language, which we have been able to follow in various reality shows, is returning to our homeland. The reason for moving to Croatia lies in her new project, performance or musical Menopause, in which she will play alongside Sanja Doležal, Arijana Čulina and Karmela Vukov Colić. He moved there after eleven years or so. for the first time since she changed her gender. That she is as happy as ever, Salome does not hide; she recently got her hair cut, she lost weight, and now she lives in as many as two countries and has full hands on shows with us in Croatia. “If anyone has to talk about hormonal changes, it's me. Women are not aware that they were given femininity at birth, and I had to create it. For many years, I worked hard to create the woman I was supposed to be born.


Sanja Dolezal, Salome, Karmela Vukov Colic and Arijana Culin PHOTO: MARE MILIN

In the show, I represent part of my struggle to finally become who I am, and at the same time, I put my heart at the women, to be grateful for being women, "says Salome, who was born on Rab as Nenad during a time when transsexuality was not spoken. “I was everything at the time, but not a man. People thought that I made such a person out of myself, they did not realize that people were born that way, "added Salome, who moved to Slovenia, to the country because of the surroundings and people who could not and did not accept her. accepting her otherness. "Even the women who attend church regularly have welcomed me, and that means a lot to me," is pleased with Salome, who visits her native Rab every year, where her parents live. The fact that their son became a daughter was difficult for the father and mother to accept. “When people are younger, they are overwhelmed by what their neighbors will say, and then they come to years when they realize that their child is important. I'm not a killer, I'm not a thief, I'm not a drug addict, I'm not a prostitute, why would anyone want to condemn me? I am living my life and I am happy because I finally became what I always wanted, "she says, adding that she never imagined that she would once have two apartments - one in Zagreb, the other in Ljubljana. “I will be on the road a lot, but I am very much looking forward. I am forever grateful and happy that this door has opened to me, "says Salome, who became a Slovene version of Menopause, featuring Helena Blagne, Urška Vučak Markež, and Star Mlakar, or Damjana Golavšek, a real celebrity .


Salome on stage with Helena Blagne, Zvezda Mlakar and Urško Vučak Markež PHOTO: JURE MAKOVEC

Even the women who go to church on a regular basis have welcomed me, and that means a lot to me.
